subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Fast vs. Slow Thinking: System 1 and System 2
description: A quick, practical guide to Fast vs. Slow Thinking: System 1 and System 2.

hook.text: Daniel Kahneman won a Nobel Prize for proving that humans have two brainsâ€”one fast, one slow.

buildup.text: System 1 is instant and automatic. System 2 is deliberate and logical. Both run every decision you make.

discovery.text: Founders use System 1 for daily fires and System 2 for strategy. Problems start when they swap roles.

twist.text: Most startup mistakes happen when System 1 handles complex decisions that deserve System 2's attention.

climax.text: Bezos reserves his mornings for System 2 decisions. By afternoon, he knows his brain runs on autopilot.

punchline.text: Know which brain you're using before you decide.
